node.title: Insurance Council calls for NZ to invest in climate change mitigation measures
node.description: The council's chief executive, Tim Grafton, says recent flooding events show the country cannot just keep repairing flooded areas.
node.content:
["The Insurance Council says New Zealand should follow a recent move by the Australian government and start putting substantial money aside to reduce the impact of climate change.", "", "
Roads around Buller were impassable after heavy rains hit the West Coast in February. Photo: Supplied / Civil Defence
", "Its chief executive, Tim Grafton, says repeat flooding events such as those on the West Coast and in Tairāwhiti show the country cannot just keep repairing flooded areas.", "He said that in the most recent Australian budget A$150 million (NZ$162m) was assigned to flood mitigation and planning.", ""Our counterparts over in Australia are calling on that kind of funding - even up to about $200 million Australian a year - to be regularly invested into climate change adaptation risk reduction measures."", "Grafton said New Zealand needed to do the same."]
